definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: Mining and oil stocks moved lower, especially in London.
sentences.chinese: 倫敦股市方面，礦業和石油個股開盤走低。

sentences.english: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA 11,063, -31.79, -0.29%)  closed slightly lower on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 道瓊斯工業平均指數週五收盤時小幅走低。
風險估值走低，事情趨於平衡。

sentences.english: Other cotton-producing areas with lower cotton prices market transactions are light.
sentences.chinese: 而別的棉產區隨着棉價走低市場成交均爲清淡。

sentences.english: Asian shares dropped and U.S. index futures fluctuated.
sentences.chinese: 亞洲股市走低，美股期貨波動起伏。

sentences.english: Caterpillar Inc. helped lead industrial shares lower.
sentences.chinese: 卡特彼勒公司帶領工業股一路走低。

sentences.english: If inflation tapers off, China's stockscould get a boost.
sentences.chinese: 如果通脹走低，中國的股市將得到提振。

sentences.english: Treasurys slipped but it seemed to be a coincidence.
sentences.chinese: 當時美國國債走低，不過看起來只是巧合。

sentences.english: There was offshore trading of the rupee, which was sharply lower.
sentences.chinese: 印度盧比在離岸交易中大幅走低。

sentences.english: Japanese stocks, which had already been in a downtrend continued to fall.
sentences.chinese: 日本的股票，在此之前持續走低。

sentences.english: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA 11, 063, -31.79, -0.29%) closed slightly lower on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 道瓊斯工業平均指數週五收盤時小幅走低。

sentences.english: Continued low open lower, Yin sunset bar line charge, potential is still weak.
sentences.chinese: 續開低走低，陰日落棒線收出，勢仍弱。

sentences.english: Star Salaries Coming Down in Hollywood?
sentences.chinese: 身價走低好萊塢大牌明星還值多少錢？

sentences.english: According to knows present US dollar exchange Renminbi the exchange rate also to continue to walk lowly.
sentences.chinese: 據知現在美元兌換人民幣的匯率還在繼續走低。

sentences.english: It will not decline largely, because it will not have how many froths .
sentences.chinese: 它不會大幅走低，因爲它本身就沒有多少泡沫。

sentences.english: Yet falling prices, in the long run, may not be all good news.
sentences.chinese: 不過從長遠來看，油價持續走低或許也不全是好事。

definition: (of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
